intro: Passerina galpinii, commonly known as the Galpin's pasqueflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its showy, early spring blooms. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It has palmate leaves and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers with numerous stamens. Passerina galpinii is adapted to arid environments and is often found in areas with well-drained soils.
